summary:
"Lost in Translation" is a 2003 movie by Sofia Coppola about an aging actor, Bob Harris (Bill Murray), who has a midlife crisis while promoting whisky in Tokyo. He befriends Charlotte (Scarlett Johansson), a young American graduate feeling lost. The film explores feelings of isolation and disconnect in a foreign culture.

Coppola wrote it after falling in love with Tokyo. She wanted Murray for the role and kept pursuing him until he agreed. Filming was quick and flexible, with lots of improvisation. The movie was a big success, making over $118 million and winning several awards, including an Academy Award for Coppola's screenplay.
title: Lost in Translation (film)
